output_list.reason: Integer overflow in the line `totalBounty += _value;`. Integer overflow allows an attacker to set the balance arbitrarily high, allowing the attacker to claim ownership of the smart contract.
The ChuCunLingAIGO smart contract allows unauthorized access to certain function, allowing attackers to steal assets.
Predictable winner selection without secure randomness enables exploitation.

Integer overflow in the line `totalSupply = _initialAmount * 10 ** uint256(_initialAmount);`. Integer overflow allows an attacker to set the balance arbitrarily high, allowing the attacker to claim ownership of the smart contract.
Refund logic is improperly tied to state updates, enabling DoS attacks.
Missing access control checks allow any user to claim ownership and funds.
Allow unlimited token minting without constraints, disrupting supply-demand balance.
